page.title: 08Employment
page.content: Employment Other than the farming families few work on farms. Women work part-time fruit or mushroom picking, with Sun Valley Poultry, or in local shops and pubs. Full-time employment is mostly in Hereford which has the usual market-town and other light industries. Some are self or unemployed, retired or have professions as solicitors, teachers, estate agents, a potter and someone who runs an organisation helping problem families. Some farms take guests or caravans. Others have 'sidelines':- i) large-scale lettuce growing, ii) marquee-hire firm, iii) trout fishing for hire, iv) a haulage business, for the 4th generation, v) riding school for dressage, etc.
